title: Los Angeles prevails in divisional round win over Chicago
content: The Bears had been kings of comeback wins, but the Rams are the ones advancing to the NFC title game.

title: Uneven Rams overcome 'bad coaching' in OT win
content: The Rams overcame what Sean McVay called "bad coaching" in Sunday's win over the Bears, using a dominant defensive performance and timely plays to gut out the victory.

title: Stroud on career-worst 4 INTs: 'Let people down'
content: Houston QB C.J. Stroud shouldered the blame after one of the worst outings of his career saw the Texans' season end in a loss to the Patriots.

title: Bears' Williams: Future bright despite painful exit
content: Caleb Williams and the Bears expressed frustration with the way the season abruptly ended, but they left Sunday night with a positive outlook for the future.

title: Pats' D fueled by talk, makes statement vs. Texans
content: Thanks to a swarming defensive performance -- which tied the franchise postseason record with four interceptions -- the Patriots advance to the AFC Championship Game next Sunday against the Broncos.

title: KD moves past idol Dirk for 6th on scoring list
content: Kevin Durant moved into sixth all time on the NBA's career scoring list, passing Dirk Nowitzki, someone the Rockets forward said he has "idolized."

title: Ayton's perfect game helps L.A. right ship in win
content: Deandre Ayton became the first Lakers player since at least 1977-78 to finish a game with 25 points on 100% shooting with zero turnovers.

title: Big Ten, SEC still deadlocked on CFP expansion
content: College Football Playoff leaders held an annual business meeting Sunday but did not reach a resolution on a future format as a deadline looms Friday.

title: Gotterup wins Sony Open, cracks top 20 in world
content: Chris Gotterup opened the new PGA Tour season with three big birdies on the back nine that carried him to a 6-under 64 and a two-shot victory in the Sony Open.

content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 26 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff-return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

content: Indiana's quarterback has deep roots in South Florida, creating some split loyalties for the title game.

content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? Matthew Stafford is in a funk? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

content: Fan clashes, VAR controversies, missed penalties, a walkout, Senegal's extra time winner - the AFCON final had it all.

content: What a weekend! Man United stunned their rivals City in a fiery derby, Senegal won AFCON amid controversial scenes, Thomas Frank is on the brink as Spurs boss and Barcelona somehow lost at Real Sociedad.

content: There's mutual interest, but there's also the matter of the QB's recovery from a December torn Achilles.

content: There haven't been a lot of headline deals in this division so far, but there's still work left this winter.

content: Leo Carlsson, Brayden Point and Seth Jones are among those ailing ahead of Milan Cortina. Plus, what to watch in the NHL this week.

content: Alex de Minaur talked to ESPN about his home major, his "Best Actor" award and the ongoing challenge of playing Alcaraz and Sinner.

content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: Indiana could go 16-0 with a title game win -- but it wouldn't be the first. Meet 1894 Yale
content: Indiana could complete a 16-0 season with a national championship win over Miami on Monday night. But it won't be the first team to accomplish the feat.

content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: Kevin Stefanski to Falcons: Grading the hire and the impact on Penix
content: Kevin Stefanski didn't have a great record in Cleveland, but he'll have more talent to work with in Atlanta.

content: The 63-year-old has been able to call his own shot in this coaching search and wound up choosing the Giants.

content: Chelsea's Enzo Fern√°ndez could be available this summer as Real Madrid and PSG monitor his situation. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail UFC championship predictions in 2026

title: Nitin Nabin elected BJP chief unopposed: To take charge tomorrow; PM Modi to attend event
content: Nitin Nabin has been elected unopposed as the national president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, set to formally take charge on January 20. His uncontested election, at 45 years old, signifies a generational leadership shift within the party. The smooth transition highlights the BJP's internal consensus and procedural discipline ahead of future elections.

title: T20 WC: BCB denies ICC deadline; reiterates demand for alternative venue
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has denied reports that the ICC set a January 21 deadline for a T20 World Cup decision, saying no timeline was given. Bangladesh has again asked for an alternative venue, citing security and pride. Talks continue amid conflicting claims, with the ICC reluctant to change schedules and Bangladesh pushing for a venue or group swap.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: Ind vs NZ: Can Nitish Reddy be Hardik Pandya's backup? Former cricketer gives verdict
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes Nitish Kumar Reddy should have featured earlier in the ODI series against New Zealand. Pathan highlighted Reddy's promising batting and bowling performances, suggesting he could be a valuable backup for Hardik Pandya. The youngster's potential to play big shots and bowl at decent speeds impressed Pathan, who advocates for continued management support.

title: A 'golden' bid for dominance: Decoding Trump's Greenland grab; knock-out blow for Russia, China?
content: Donald Trump's renewed focus on Greenland, linked to his 'Golden Dome' missile defence proposal, signals a strategic shift.  This Arctic island is seen as vital for US national security, offering a crucial vantage point against Russia and China.  The ambitious 'Golden Dome' aims for near-invulnerability, sparking global concerns over strategic stability and the militarisation of space.

title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
content: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: 'Fabricated': K'taka DGP after 'compromising' video goes viral; CM warns of action
content: Karnataka DGP (civil rights enforcement) K Ramachandra Rao is under scrutiny after a video allegedly showing him in a compromising position with women went viral. Rao has rejected the videos as fabricated and false, while Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has vowed strict action and an investigation if guilt is found.

title: Manipur teen who was abducted and gang-raped in 2023 dies as FIR remains pending
content: A 20-year-old Kuki-Zo woman, a survivor of brutal sexual violence during Manipur's ethnic riots, has died from her injuries. Allegedly gang-raped and left for dead in May 2023, her case remains unresolved with no attackers identified. Her death highlights the ongoing suffering and calls for justice for the community.

title: DeepMind CEO drops bombshell: ChatGPT can't invent science; missing a 'world model'
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis argues that large language models like ChatGPT are hitting a wall in achieving true scientific breakthroughs. He believes they lack a 'world model' to understand causality, unlike DeepMind's systems that simulate reality. This perspective challenges OpenAI's scaling strategy amid industry shifts and a race for advanced AI.

title: CBSE revises affiliation rules to make student counseling mandatory: Check details here
content: CBSE has revised its affiliation norms to make counseling and career guidance mandatory across all affiliated schools. Approved in November 2025, the changes require trained Counseling & Wellness Teachers and Career Counselors based on student strength. The move aims to strengthen mental health support, ensure professional guidance, and promote holistic student development beyond academics.

title: 5 takeaways from Donald Trump's threatening letter to Norway PM
content: Trump‚Äôs line about no longer feeling obligated to think ‚Äúpurely of peace‚Äù has been read by some as emotional blackmail over the Nobel Prize. That misses the point. Trump is not rejecting peace as an outcome. He is rejecting peace as a constraint.

title: Bill Belichick lands new ESPN role as North Carolina looks ahead after 4‚Äì8 season
content: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN‚Äôs ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina‚Äôs head coach ended at 4‚Äì8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels‚Äô April 12 spring game.

title: Tom Brady grows wary of past mistakes with Alix Earle amid romance rumors
content: Tom Brady and popular influencer, Alix Earle, turned heads with their romance at the New Year‚Äôs Eve party in St. Barth‚Äôs. The two were spotted standing close to each other as Alix Earle rubbed Tom Brady‚Äôs back. This has sparked chaos among fans as many are excited about their future. But it seems the NFL legend might be ‚Äúsuspicious‚Äù of Alix Earle.

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
content: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Raised among doctors and professors, Aman Mokhade leads Vidarbha to VHT glory
content: Vidarbha's Aman Mokhade etched his name in history by scoring 814 runs, becoming the third player to breach the 800-run mark in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Inspired by net sessions with Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, Mokhade's stellar performance led Vidarbha to their maiden title. His father's unwavering support was crucial in his cricketing journey.

title: 'Curiosity about blondes': Teen boy gropes American woman on Delhi metro
content: An American woman experienced sexual harassment on the Delhi Metro when a teenage boy groped her after she agreed to a photo. The boy's mother defended his actions, claiming he was curious about blondes. The incident left the woman deeply disturbed, and her account has sparked condemnation of the family's response and apologies from other Indians.

title: What the NEET PG 2025 cut-off crash reveals about exam governance
content: Resident doctors' associations are questioning the integrity of NEET PG 2025, citing a series of failures including opaque processes, arbitrary disqualifications, and drastically lowered cut-off scores. This has led to accusations of an institutional collapse, with eligibility decoupled from performance and merit diluted, eroding public trust in the medical profession.

title: 'Welcome brother': PM Modi, UAE prez ride in same car; what's on agenda
content: UAE resident Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan received a special welcome from Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi for a high-level visit. The leaders are set to discuss advancing the India-UAE Comprehensive Strategic Partnership and regional issues, building on recent high-level exchanges and strong bilateral ties.

title: Khabib Nurmagomedov net worth timeline: How UFC legend built wealth (2016‚Äì26)
content: Khabib Nurmagomedov went from a quiet fighter in Dagestan to one of the biggest stars in UFC history. He retired in 2020 with a perfect 29‚Äì0 record and massive fight earnings. After leaving the cage, he grew his wealth through coaching, MMA promotions, and business projects. By 2025‚Äì2026, his net worth sits in the tens of millions, built from smart moves beyond fighting.

title: Neha Kakkar announces break from work after Candy Shop backlash
content: Neha Kakkar announced a break from work, relationships, and public life after Candy Shop‚Äîher song with brother Tony Kakkar‚Äîfaced massive online trolling for "vulgar" lyrics and "cringe" K-pop vibes. Released Dec 15, 2025, it hit 23M YouTube views amid backlash. She seeks privacy, no cameras.

title: PSL adopts IPL-style auction; scraps draft system to 'increase transparency'
content: The Pakistan Super League will adopt a player auction system from its 11th season, mirroring the Indian Premier League's model. This change, along with an increased franchise purse to USD 1.6 million, aims to boost transparency and competitive balance. Franchises can now retain a maximum of four players, with new teams getting pre-auction picks.

title: Frantic calls, 90-min fight: How Noida techie battled death in open pit; what autopsy reveals
content: A software engineer tragically drowned in a deep, water-filled pit after his SUV crashed in dense fog. Despite desperate attempts to signal for help, rescue efforts were hampered by poor visibility and the pit's depth. An FIR has been filed against the builders for negligence, highlighting a lack of safety measures at the construction site.

title: Unnao rape: Delhi HC rejects Kuldeep Sengar's plea to suspend 10-year jail term
content: The Delhi High Court will decide today on former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's plea to suspend his sentence in the Unnao custodial death case. Sengar, serving a 10-year term for the father's death and a life sentence for rape, has argued he's served nearly nine years.

title: IMF lifts India‚Äôs 2025 growth forecast to 7.3%; global resilience offset tariff shocks
content: The IMF has upgraded India's 2025 growth outlook to 7.3%, citing strong corporate earnings and economic momentum. Global growth is projected to hold steady at 3.3% this year, with resilience driven by AI investment and easing trade tensions. However, risks remain from AI sector valuations and escalating geopolitical uncertainties.

title: ICC deadline puts Bangladesh T20 WC spot under threat; this team next in line
content: Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup remains uncertain as the ICC set a January 21 deadline for confirmation. Citing security concerns, the Bangladesh Cricket Board requested matches be moved to Sri Lanka, with Scotland potentially replacing them if they withdraw. Discussions are ongoing, with a group swap also considered.

title: Dreams do come true: How Stephen Curry created a lifetime memory for a young NBA fan
content: During a recent game against the Hornets, Stephen Curry surprised a young fan by inviting him onto the court to participate in his pre-game warmup. The fan successfully delivered a high-bounce pass to Curry, creating a viral moment. This heartwarming interaction further solidifies Curry's reputation for connecting with his fans, adding to his legacy of fan-first gestures.

title: Many jobs now preferring education less than 10th grade: Where is the Indian job market heading?
content: Education, once a trusted hiring filter, is losing its signalling power in India‚Äôs job market. Employers in high-volume sectors now prioritise immediate productivity over formal qualifications, exposing a widening gap between degrees and job readiness. With most higher education institutions misaligned with industry needs, employment and education are steadily drifting apart.

title: Why sleep anxiety in adults is more common today than you think
content: From doom-scrolling to sleep trackers, work stress and lifestyle habits are quietly turning bedtime into a source of anxiety for adults.

title: Drama! Players walk off, Panenka missed, and Senegal lift AFCON final title - Watch
content: Senegal won the AFCON final after a night of chaos in Rabat. Players walked off in protest after a late VAR penalty for Morocco, fans clashed with security, and the match was delayed. Morocco missed a Panenka, saved by Edouard Mendy, before Pape Gueye scored in extra time to seal a 1-0 win and Senegal‚Äôs second title.

title: 'Grant bail in case of delayed trial': Ex-CJI DY Chandrachud cites Umar Khalid case
content: Former CJI DY Chandrachud emphasized that prolonged detention without trial, citing Umar Khalid's case, undermines constitutional justice and necessitates bail. He urged courts to rigorously scrutinize national security claims, stating that if expeditious trials aren't possible, bail should be the rule, not the exception.

title: Operation Trashi-I: Paratrooper killed in encounter with terrorists in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: A fierce gun battle in Kishtwar's remote forests left eight Army personnel injured on Sunday. Security forces engaged two to three suspected foreign terrorists during a search operation. Reinforcements have been deployed, and a massive hunt is underway to neutralize the militants. This marks the third encounter in the Jammu region this year, with intensified operations ahead of Republic Day.

title: Apartment vs Independent House: Which is a better option to choose and why
content: Choosing between an apartment and a house involves weighing convenience, security, and shared amenities against privacy and freedom. Apartments offer affordability and community, while independent homes provide ultimate control and potential for land appreciation. Your lifestyle, budget, and future plans will ultimately guide this significant decision.

title: India on cusp of upper-middle income status; per capita income to rise; economy set to be 3rd largest
content: India‚Äôs climb up the income ladder was slow for decades, taking 60 years to move from low income to lower-middle income. Since then, growth has sharply accelerated, and a likely transition into the upper-middle-income category by around 2030.

title: Snap elections in Japan: Why Sanae Takaichi is taking big gamble - explained
content: Japanese prime minister Sanae Takaichi has called a snap election for February 8, dissolving parliament to seek a direct mandate from voters. This move aims to strengthen her grip on power amidst low ruling party popularity and a slim parliamentary majority. The election will test her leadership against concerns over inflation and China tensions.

title: Several Killed In Blast In Afghanistan's Kabul, Says Taliban Ministry
content: Several people were killed in a blast in Afghan capital Kabul's Shahr-e-Naw area, the Taliban interior ministry said on Monday.

title: Jaish Terrorist Hideout Located At Altitude Of 12,000 Feet Busted In J&K
content: Security forces have achieved a significant breakthrough in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar after busting an underground hideout of Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists located at an altitude of 12,000 feet in the Singhpora area of Chhatroo.

title: Donald Trump Wants Greenland For Ego, Not Security: Ian Bremmer To NDTV
content: The bigger issue, Bremmer said, is that "his closest advisers are reluctant to tell him hes making a big mistake. And that can get you into trouble."

title: Chhattisgarh Mid-Day Meal Cooks, Earning Rs 66 A Day, Protest For Wage Hike
content: It's been 22 days since thousands of mid-day meal cooks, mostly women, have been protesting in Chhattisgarh capital Raipur, demanding a hike in their daily wages from Rs 66 to over Rs 400.

title: 'For India, It Is TACO, Trump Always Chickens Out': Ian Bremmer To NDTV
content: Bremmer added that Modi faces no urgency to respond to Washington's demands. "It is not urgent for Modi to respond to Trump in the way he wants."

title: 'We Are Short By 6 Seats': Team Uddhav Says 'Wait And Watch' On Mumbai Mayor Race
content: While the numbers suggest a clear path for the Mahayuti Alliance, Sanjay Raut, the key troubleshooter for the Uddhav Thackeray faction, insists the race for the Mumbai Mayor's chair is far from over.

title: Rift Within Punjab Congress Over Caste? CS Channi's 'Dalit' Remark Sparks Buzz
content: A conflict over caste representation has surfaced within the Punjab Congress. The friction, which centres on the balance between Dalit and Jat Sikh influence, was triggered by a remark by former Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi.

title: UAE President Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan To Visit India On January 19
content: At the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the United Arab Emirates, will pay an official visit to India on January 19, a statement by the Ministry of External Affairs said.

title: Round 2 Of CBI Questioning For TVK's Vijay, Officials Say No Clean Chit Yet
content: Actor-politician Vijay has told the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) that he followed all safety guidelines during the rally at Tamil Nadu's Karur, where a stampede claimed 41 lives

title: "Understand The Stress": What's Behind Supreme Court's Bengal SIR Ruling
content: The Supreme Court noted that the Election Commission must understand the "stress" people are under due to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of voter lists in West Bengal

title: Nitin Nabin Files Nomination, Set To Take Over As BJP Chief Tomorrow
content: The election for the BJP's next national president moved decisively towards closure on Monday with 37 sets of nomination papers being filed in favour of senior leader Nitin Nabin, 46, virtually clearing the path for his elevation.

title: UP Woman Allegedly Hangs Self Weeks After Marriage Over Dowry Harassment
content: A 20-year-old woman was found hanging from a ceiling fan at her husband's house in Dudahi town here, police said on Monday.

title: Kerala Man Kills Parents-In-Law, Critically Injures Son
content: An elderly couple was allegedly stabbed to death and their three-year-old grandson seriously injured by their son-in-law in this district on Monday, police said.

title: 'I Killed My Wife, But It Wasn't Murder': Indian-Origin Australian Man
content: A 42-year-old Indian-origin man has admitted to killing his wife in Australia's Adelaide Magistrates Court, but said he is not guilty of murder.

title: Odisha Minister Says No Nipah Virus Scare, Bengal Situation Being Monitored
content: Odisha Health Minister Mukesh Mahaling on Monday assured residents that no cases of the Nipah virus have been detected in the state and there is no need for panic.

title: 'Approach Centre': Court Dismisses Humayun Kabir's Plea For Z Plus Security
content: The Calcutta High Court on Monday refused to entertain the plea by suspended Trinamool Congress legislator and founder of newly-floated Janata Unnayan Party (JUP), Humayun Kabir, for Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) security cover.

title: How Pahalgam Is Overcoming The Shadow Of Last Year's Terror Attack
content: In the heart of Kashmir, the picturesque landscapes of Pahalgam are finally stepping out from the shadow of uncertainty. Following a brutal terror attack last April, the valley is successfully rewriting its narrative.

title: Trade War Over Greenland "In No One's Interest": UK PM Keir Starmer
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said a "trade war is in no one's interest" on Monday, after US President Donald Trump vowed to hit Britain and European countries with tariffs over their support for Greenland.

title: Tamil Nadu Cop Arrested For Allegedly Filming Woman Colleague In Toilet
content: A Senior Sub-Inspector of Police has been arrested in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram district on charges of allegedly attempting to record a woman police colleague inside a toilet.

title: NIMHANS-type healthcare facility to come up in Mysuru
content: The facility is planned in Varuna assembly constituency for ‚Çπ100 crore; the necessary land has been transferred to Mysore Medical College and Research Institute (MMCRI) to start the works

title: YSRCP misrule ruined Revenue Department, alleges Farooq
content: Law Minister says 90% of public petitions relate to land grabbing and Section 22A disputes during the 2019‚Äì24 regime, accuses Jagan of claiming credit for TDP projects

title: Remarks about Satheesan misrepresented by media: NSS general secretary
content: He says the core issue is NSS-SNDP Yogam unity and it is unfair to assign unnecessary political significance to anyone in this context, especially with elections approaching

title: NKSSIA to host Vendor Development Programme in Hubballi tomorrow
content: It aims at providing a platform for industrialists, entrepreneurs and MSMEs in North Karnataka to interact with officials of PSUs

title: KSEB unions slam findings of vigilance raids
content: The organisations have accused the Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau of showing undue haste in portraying KSEB employees as corrupt following the ‚ÄòOperation Short Circuit‚Äô inspections in KSEB offices on January 16.

title: Writer Imayam thanks Stalin for instituting Semmozhi Literary Award
content: On January 8, he had written to the Chief Minister requesting the establishment of an award similar to the Jnanpith Award to honour writers at the national level

title: 94% paddy payments credited within 24 hours, Kharif procurement in final stage: Civil Supplies Minister
content: Nadendla Manohar says ‚Çπ9,890 crore paid to 6.83 lakh farmers so far, preparations begin for Rabi procurement to avoid Kharif lapses

title: IMPACT-VIP meet puts focus on safe medicine use for visually impaired
content: The session brings together government, international partners and representatives of the visually-impaired community

title: Value addition, industry tie-ups can boost farm growth: MIA
content: Farmers are the backbone of the country, while industries act as its supporting pillars, says Suresh Kumar Jain

title: You cannot blackmail the bench too, Madras High Court judge tells ‚ÄòSavukku‚Äô Shankar
content: Justice P. Velmurugan of Madras High Court refuses to accede to the YouTuber‚Äôs plea to recuse from hearing a plea to cancel the interim bail granted to him by another Bench in December

title: Residents in coastal hamlet in Nagapattinam district battle scarcity with underground cement water tanks
content: Incursion of saline water in borewells and inadequate piped water supply has left several fisher families in the coastal village of Keechankuppam at the mercy of private water suppliers

title: UDF will have a vision plan to address unemployment in Kerala once voted to power, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The people of Kerala should be able to do in the State itself the jobs they do abroad, says Congress leader

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: UAE President Al Nahyan arrives in India
content: Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will be in the national capital for less than two hours, according to his schedule released by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA)

title: In Focus Podcast | ‚ÄòJana Nayagan‚Äô vs. the CBFC: What goes behind censoring 720 hours of film?
content: Vijay‚Äôs farewell film, Jana Nayagan, faces a last-minute Revising Committee review, raising ‚Äúpolitical conspiracy‚Äù claims. Aroon Deep joins us on In Focus to explore film censorship.

title: Spanish train collision: EAM Jaishankar expresses grief
content: The evening train between Malaga and Madrid went off the rails near Cordoba and slammed into a train coming from Madrid to Huelva, according to a rail operator

title: Kannur cyber police nab Punjab man for duping doctor of ‚Çπ10.5 lakh in ‚Äòdigital arrest‚Äô scam
content: The accused, identified as Jeevan Ram, a native of Ludhiana, was arrested from a remote village following a high-risk operation

title: CM Stalin lays foundation stone for Mamallan reservoir, proposed as Chennai‚Äôs sixth drinking water source
content: The reservoir would have an annual storage capacity of 2.25 tmcft when filled twice and a potential to supply 170 million litres a day (mld) to Chennai

title: DGP K. Ramachandra Rao back in controversy after video of inappropriate behaviour surfaces
content: Mr. Rao told the media that the now viral video video was eight years old and was recorded when he was posted in Belagavi. He termed the incident as a conspiracy to tarnish his image.

title: Daily Quiz: On Indira Gandhi
content: A quiz on Indira Gandhi on the occasion of her becoming Prime Minister for the first time on this date 60 years ago

title: Violence, greed, desire, and anger are triggers for modern litigation in India: Justice Datta
content: Justice Dipankar Datta‚Äôs remarks come shortly after Chief Justice of India Surya Kant observes that officials are ‚Äòhand in glove‚Äô with private builders in the subversion of land laws

title: Landslide risk: protective netting to be installed on Thamarassery Ghat Road
content: Traffic regulations, including a complete ban on multi-axle and other heavy vehicles, to ease congestion on the ghat road will be strictly enforced until all renovation works are completed

title: Hindutva leader Harshita Thakur, 6 others booked for provocative gesture against dargah in Belagavi
content: The vehicle was moving in front of the Syed Ansari dargah, when Ms. Thakur made repeated gestures of shooting arrows towards the religious place. Her supporters and a few members of the crowd started cheering and clapping.

content: K. Rajan says the houses, constructed as part of broader township project on Elston Estate near Kalpetta, will be ready for occupation with all required basic facilities

title: Kuvempu University V-C welcomes release of grants, condemns Mysore University V-C‚Äôs reaction on the issue
content: University of Mysore Vice-Chancellor Prof. N.K. Lokanath had suggested that Kuvempu University was benefited more by the release of grants

title: NEET aspirant death case: Congress workers stage protest against Bihar Government
content: A large number of the Congress workers gathered near the Income Tax Crossing, holding placards and raising slogans against CM Nitish Kumar and the police

title: Rahul Gandhi skips court appearance in defamation case, next hearing on February 20
content: Rahul Gandhi has been granted a final opportunity to appear in court after missing his scheduled hearing due to prior commitments in Kerala

title: SIR in Tamil Nadu: Election Commission extends deadline for filing claims, objections until January 30
content: The Election Commission has urged eligible citizens to make use of the extended period to submit their claims and objections relating to the electoral rolls within the stipulated time frame

title: Four persons missing near Bhadra canal; one body found, search continues

content: The ED served notices directing Mithun Reddy to appear before the investigation officers on January 23

title: Kannur airport in Kerala gets quick-connection flights to London Heathrow
content: IndiGo and Air India Express begin connecting services via major Indian hubs, enhancing travel options for passengers in north Kerala

title: Vizianagaram railway station needs second entrance in view of the increase in passenger traffic over the years

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly sessions from second or third week of February
content: Deputy Speaker Raghu Ramakrishna Raju hoped that the YSRCP President Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy and the ten MLAs of that party would attend the Assembly

title: Two arrested for social media posts attempting to incite inter-State tension
content: Two functionaries of the Jananaayaga Elurchi Kazhagam allegedly posted provocative content on social media that could incite tension between Tamil Nadu and Karnataka

title: Supreme Court junks PIL on judicial reforms, terms it 'publicity interest litigation'
content: The petitioner had sought a mandate that every court in India must decide a case within a one-year timeframe

content: The Shiv Sena has shifted its 29 members to a hotel in Mumbai, ostensibly for an orientation workshop to make them aware of the functioning of the country's richest civic body, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC)

title: The AFC North: 1 coach, 2 (?) starting QBs, many questions

title: Why clamor for Man United, Tottenham 'DNA' makes no sense
content: football DNA is a term that only seems to be used when a manager/head coach is struggling and the supporters and former players boil their difficulties down tuesday . the term is used to describe a football team's traditions or do it differently and risk alienating supporters, as well as an increasingly vocal and influential cohort of former players . if you ignore the club's so-called DNA, you had better win ... and win quickly .
